sen.j: 高橋 汎（たかはし ひろし、1932年（昭和7年） -）は、シテ方金春流能楽師。
sen.e: Hiroshi TAKAHASHI (1932 -) is a Noh actor of the Konparu school of lead actors (shite-kata).
Hiroshi TAKAHASHI (1932 -) is a Noh actor of the Konparu school of shite-kata (lead actors).
Hiroshi TAKAHASHI (1932 -) is a Noh actor of the Konparu school of shite-kata (lead actors).

sen.j: 1932年奈良県大和郡山市に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Yamatokoriyama City, Nara Prefecture in 1932.
He was born in Yamatokoriyama City, Nara Prefecture in 1932.
He was born in Yamatokoriyama City, Nara Prefecture in 1932.
His father is a doctor of internal medicine.
His father is a doctor of internal medicine.
His father is a doctor of internal medicine.

sen.j: 七十九世金春信高、七十八世金春八条に師事。
sen.e: He was apprenticed to Nobutaka KONPARU the 79th and Hachijo KONPARU the 78th.
He was apprenticed to Nobutaka KONPARU, the 79th head of the school, and Hachijo KONPARU, the 78th head of the school.
sen.cmt: the 79th→, the 79th head of the school、the 78th→, the 78th head of the schoolとしました。
sen.e: He was apprenticed to Nobutaka KONPARU, the 79th head of the school, and Hachijo KONPARU, the 78th head of the school.

sen.j: なお七十九世の最初の弟子である。
sen.e: He is the first disciple of Nobutaka KONPARU the 79th.
He is the first disciple of Nobutaka KONPARU the 79th.
He is the first disciple of Nobutaka KONPARU the 79th.
He made his debut as a player of a child's part in "Funa Benkei" (Benkei in the Boat) in 1942.
He made his debut as a player of a child's part in "Funa Benkei" (Benkei in the Boat) in 1942.
He made his debut as a player of a child's part in "Funa Benkei" (Benkei in the Boat) in 1942.

sen.j: その後『乱』『道成寺』『翁』『獅子』『定家』『卒都婆小町』を披く。
sen.e: Then, he performed "Midare" (The Drunken Elf), "Dojoji" (Dojo-ji Temple), "Okina" (The Old Man), "Shishi" (mythical lion), "Teika" (The Vine of Teika), and "Sotoba Komachi" (Komachi on the Gravepost).
sen.cmt: 「獅子」の正式なタイトルが不明です。
sen.e: Then, he performed "Midare" (The Drunken Elf), "Dojoji" (Dojo-ji Temple), "Okina" (The Old Man), "Shishi" (mythical lion), "Teika" (The Vine of Teika), and "Sotoba Komachi" (Komachi on the Gravepost).

Then, he performed "Midare" (The Drunken Elf), "Dojoji" (Dojo-ji Temple), "Okina" (The Old Man), "Shishi" (mythical lion), "Teika" (The Vine of Teika), and "Sotoba Komachi" (Komachi on the Gravepost).

sen.j: その中、35歳で妻子を伴い東京へ転居。
sen.e: About that time, at the age of 35, he moved to Tokyo with his family.
About that time, at the age of 35, he moved to Tokyo with his family.
About that time, at the age of 35, he moved to Tokyo with his family.

sen.j: 1975年重要無形文化財（能楽総合）に認定。
sen.e: He was designated as Important Intangible Cultural Property (Noh Play) in 1975.
He was designated as Important Intangible Cultural Property (Noh Play) in 1975.
He was designated as Important Intangible Cultural Property (Noh Play) in 1975.

sen.j: 1992年カナダ・モントリオール能楽公演に参加。
sen.e: He participated in the Noh performance held in Montreal, Canada in 1992.
He participated in the Noh performance held in Montreal, Canada in 1992.
He participated in the Noh performance held in Montreal, Canada in 1992.
He received the Order of the Rising Sun, 5th Class, Gold and Silver Rays in 2002.
He received the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold and Silver Rays in 2002.
sen.cmt: 「勲五等双光旭日章」の表記を修正 (参照:http://dictionary.goo.ne.jp/leaf/je2/20896/m0u/)
sen.e: He received the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold and Silver Rays in 2002.

sen.j: （社）日本能楽会監事、（社）金春円満井会理事長。
sen.e: Supervisor of the Nogaku Performers' Association and Chief Director of the Konparu Enmai-kai
Supervisor of the Association for Japanese Noh Plays and Chief Director of the Konparu Enmai-kai.
sen.cmt: "the No(h)gaku Performers' Association"は「能楽協会」の訳のため、"the Association for Japanese Noh Plays"に修正、ピリオド追加
sen.e: Supervisor of the Association for Japanese Noh Plays and Chief Director of the Konparu Enmai-kai.
